result.execSummary:
The defendant Tawny M. Saltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Tawny M. Saltz in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for Amended Information; Court grants motion to Amended Information Ct. 1 Misdemeanor Bail Jumping 946.49(1)(1), 939.51(3)(a);  Joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; advised of rights; Defendant pleads NC to amended Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on Ct. 1 - Sentence 6 months county jail; with Huber; zero days credit consecutive to 14CF154; IMPOSED & STAYED; 2 years probation concurrent to 14CF154; AODA treatment and follow-thru (05-01-2015); absolute sobriety/no possession or consumption of alcohol/drug use without a valid Rx.; fine/costs payble to DOC $443.00.  Report to probation and parole today.
Defendant Tawny M. Saltz in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tawny M. Saltz in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of information, pleads NG, getting close to resolution  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tawny M. Saltz in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF waives right to preliminary hearing,  Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Tawny Saltz in court with Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman; Brue Poquette for the State.  Advised of rights/acknowledges receipt of complaint.  SIBS $1,000 no special conditions.  Preliminary Hearing time limits waived.
